name: Jamestown
overview:
Jamestown is an established investment leader among international real estate funds investing in U.S. properties. Beginning in 1983, Jamestown is respected by investors, partners and competitors as a focused and sophisticated real estate investment firm.

Their investments include One Times Square, Chelsea Market and 111 8th Avenue in New York City along with dozens of properties across the Southeast. Jamestown earned a $1 billion profit for its investors with the 2006 sale of 1211 Avenue of Americas.

Jamestown is focused on two primary markets: 24-hour cities and Sunbelt markets with strong demographic growth. With a mix of core and opportunistic funds, Jamestown pursues a wide variety of transactions.
